question: What is the major way that economic anthropology is different from the discipline of economics?

answers.text: Anthropologists take a human centered-approach rather than a market-centered approach.
Anthropologists take a universalist approach, looking at humans all over the world.
Economists look at changes in an economy over time, as opposed to economic anthropologists, who research one culture in depth at a single point in time.
Economists focus on developed countries, and economic anthropologists look at the developing world.
